summary: Dr. Vitalis O. Ojiegbe was found guilty of unprofessional conduct, failing to meet appropriate standards for quality medical care, violating the Maryland Pharmacy Act regarding drug dispensing and packaging, and failing to keep adequate medical records. These violations also constituted a breach of a prior March 12, 2015 Consent Order. As a result, his license was suspended for a minimum of six months, he was permanently prohibited from dispensing medications from his office, and he is required to undergo an evaluation to determine his safe return to practice.
